intro: Agalinis bangii, commonly known as the Bangi's false foxglove, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, disturbed habitats. Agalinis bangii is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves.
